I think all of you know what I mean when I talk about a burrito with all of the meat shoved into one corner and all of the sour cream and guac into another corner. Those burritos piss me off. Anyways, the point that I'm trying to make is that the guys behind the counter knew how to properly wrap a burrito. Every bite that I took was filled with just the right amount of meat, rice, beans, and salsa/sides. The meat was flavorful, the rice was moist and seasoned just right, the beans were beans, and all the flavors just came together really nicely. The only downside that I want to mention is the greasiness of the food: these guys aren't shy about putting a little extra oil and fat to bring everything together. With that said, you only live once, right?

Enough about the burrito, let's focus on the chips now. A burrito will tell you about a taqueria's attention to detail, but the chips will tell you about a taqueria's dedication to the big picture. I think if you're going to put chips in my bag, you better mean for them to be there. I'm not the kind of person that takes kindly to the Chevy's style, paper napkin chips or the dried out, pre-packaged Tostitos. Anyways, these chips didn't disappoint. They were hefty, like the burrito, and thick cut so you won't get dirty looks from your girlfriend when you have to finger the broken chip out of the salsa that you're sharing with her. These chips had everything that you could want: a nice color, shape, texture, and crunch. Again, they were pretty greasy, but I didn't care too much.

Alright, so here's the final breakdown for the stars from a baseline of 3:
+1 for great portions for the price (~$10 for my ~8 inch burrito)
+1 for having delicious, delicious burritos and chips
-1 for sketchy looking sanitation, if you know what I mean
author: Frank Y.

description:
I got a bunch of burritos for a business lunch and they were a hit.  Teachers on the southeast side of the City are burrito connoisseurs (or they ought to be given the number of great taquerias around here) and we all agreed that these were pretty awesome.  

As per usual, one burrito is two meals unless you're crazy-hungry.  Not per usual: meat wasn't super-greasy, the beans were whole, and the salsa spicy.

The only drawback was when I was placing the phone order.  I had to correct them over ten times, and it wasn't a language issue, it was the person not paying attention to what I was saying (and I swear I wasn't talking a mile a minute--my coworker was listening and started to silently laugh his ass off as I repeated myself for the 9th time).  When he went to pick up everything, he noticed the people in front of him in the line having similar problems.  So 1/2 star off for that.  Also 1/2 star off for arguing with him about taking the small covered cups for salsa.  Our order was over $100, so I'd think that was worth $0.10 of plastic!

Still, the food's awesome and they're a small business, so that's a win-win worth some a little extra frustration.
author: Jen D.

description: steak and scrimp burritos!!!!!!!  CHOWWWNNNNKYYYYY mofos too..birria and menudo on sundays is da one...rite before niners smash...down it wit a cold negra and you ret ta go!!!  on da rilla tho the burritos are bomb the scrimp is always fresh...the pastor and carnitas are always hella tender...fresh agua frescas...i always get the fresa but the horchata is really good too...lifelong memeber up in this piece!!!
author: Bane V.

description: The place was ok for me as far as burritos goes.  They stuff it with so much rice and sauce I couldn't really taste the pollo.  It was defintely spacious and clean though.  I wouldn't mind coming back but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: May B.

description: I picked up four heavy burritos while visiting my grandparents in this neighborhood. The burritos were packed with well-prepared and quite tasty carnes/meats -- carnitas (deep fried pork) and pollo asado (grilled chicken) with al pastor (grilled barbecue pork) for the combination burrito of which I tried. Despite the lack of cheese and lackluster Mexican or Spanish rice being the only two drawbacks, I was very satisfied. Not dinging them a star for the chips and salsa, which were complimentary, but the tortilla chips were too thick (have had much thinner chips and not sure if theirs is housemade and fresh) and the salsa didn't have enough juice but it was still had lots of flavor coming from the onions and cilantro.
author: Cliff W.

description:
My favorite place to get Mexican food EVER!  This place is truly the best.  I lived in the neighborhood for about 11 years before I moved.  I've been a customer since I was a kid.  I don't come here as often anymore, but whenever I have the time and it just so happens I'm in the neighborhood, I'll grab a Super Chicken Burrito here.

The burritos here have the perfect amount of zest and spice to make you a Cinco De Mayo burrito eater for life!  But seriously though, one bite and there's gonna be a rave in your mouth.
author: Joyce C.

description: Tried after reading the reviews so maybe I expected more.  Anyways, its a decent place, I've had better and worse burritos.  I'll give it another try before I say more
author: Cri S.

description:
Like many other reviews I've read about this place, I live close by but never bought something from here before. Today was my first time. I read about the super burrito and that got me interested. 

It took a couple minutes for the cook to make the burrito. I was surprised it was so fast. Guess only the meat needs cooking. The other ingredients were readily available.

update: upped to 4 stars. Been going here more often and I'm a fan... although I wouldn't eat here everyday.  I have yet to try to nachos and other stuff.
author: Vincent C.

description:
I love this place but always hesitant to walk by there. San Bruno ave is dangerous @ night. I've been living here for 10 yrs. It has gotten better but not much.

I have only tried their burrito. It's huge and decently priced. Shrimps is the best to my preference, but a bit pricier than chicken or beef. Chips are given, but I'm not sure if you have to pay addition for salsa. I'd come here more often if it wasn't the neigborhood that it's in. I think it closes @ 8PM on Sunday.
author: MT D.

description: Ended my weekend in Sf at this place based on my location and yelp reviews.  It was empty when I went in at 1 on a Monday I don't know if its always like that but don't let it fool you.  I had a carnetas super burrito.  It was HUGE, the burrito ended up getting a little wet because of the salsa but the taste made it worth it.  I don't normally go to places like this in Sf so I really enjoyed this. Probably got into my top 3 burritos.
author: Nick F.

description: I was out in SF and decided to go to Cinco De Mayo Taqueria to grab some dinner with a friend.  The food was serve very quickly and that is probably why my food was not good.  I got a burrito and it was the first burrito I did not like in a long time.  This place has positive reviews so maybe I lucked out but I will not be coming back to this location.
author: Herm K.

description:
This place makes the best burritos in the world!!!  I lived in LA for years and all over the Bay Area and this place has the BEST burritos ever!!!  I hate places that just pour tons of hot sauce and jalapenos and have no taste.  You can get a mild burrito here and it still has lots of flavor!  

We always have trouble finding parking but it is SO worth it!
author: fusita t.

description:
For it to charge so much for a burrito and call itself a taqueria is outrageous.  If you go to the Mission and go into a taqueria or another burrito joint even like the Gordos chain, they don't charge this much for burritos.

They don't even throw in free chips like other places.

Their food is good and kinda big but I can get the same for much cheaper elsewhere.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Oh - I just realized you can pay with a card here. Exciting and handy! Now if they would only stay open a little bit later . . . .
author: Allegra F.

description: Super suiza carne asada from Cinco De Mayo  and a negra modelo..the perfect lunch in SF.
author: Mike R.

description: Cinco de Mayo serves up a good burrito when you're in the area and can't get to or dont want to head out to the Mission.  i've found their grilled chicken to be dry sometimes, so i usually get the carne asada super burrito with everything - but carne asada anything is good.  their steak is well marinated and cooked to order.  it's always tender and moist and provides the right amount of juicy saltiness to the burrito.  this place will definitely fill your burrito craving, but if you're willing and able, i'd still go to El Faro Lito.
author: Norman N.

description: One of the best burritos I've ever had the pleasure of eating, nice and juicy.  I wish they were open late; I used to go to this place once a week.
author: Danny L.

description: I am in LOOOOOOOOOVE with this taqueria! This is defitnetly the best place to get mexican food. Not in the Mission, in San Bruno near the fire station! I come here at least once a week. I had the chicken enchilada a couple times here and it is the BOMB! Also the quesidillas are really good here. But I usually just get the super burrito. The super burrito is super juicy so be prepared with TONS of napkins, you'll need it. It's just perfect...... It's so delicious that it's just unexplainable. You defitnetly just have to try it to see what I'm talking about :D Totally worth $7.
author: Didi L.

description: This place, hands down, has one of the best burritos I have ever had in my entire life. I grew up around the south bay area where the Mexican food was below mediocre, then I moved down to southern california where it's supposedly the "burrito mecca", yet every time I have a burrito at King Taco per-say, I always happen crave a Cinco De Mayo burrito. There's something about their burrito that is so different than the others. When I bite into one, their carnitas are a perfect crisp, the carne asada has an explosion of flavor, and what's great about it is the el grande burrito can mix both of those meats into one! When you get to the middle of the burrito you can experience a euphoria of flavors, the juices coming from the meat, the cold pico, and they can even spice it up for you. Service here is always quick, plenty of space to sit, the only downside is that the area is a little sketchy, but nothing has happened to me thus far, and I've been coming here for 3-4 years now, so don't be scared to try one of the best burritos you will ever have in your lifetime
author: Roy H.

description:
I had two tacos from El Farolito at Mission last week for $4.25 total.
Two tacos at Cinco De Mayo was $5.25, with about 25-40% less stuff.

Cinco De Mayo tacos lack the onion cruchiness, which I enjoy a lot. There was nothing special or worthy to comment regarding the taste.

Not the best bang for the buck, but I guess you don't have
author: Ivan L.

description: I ate there once and was so unimpressed that I've never been back.  I really can't recommend it, when there are so many good Mexican restaurants in town.
author: Andi T.

description: Best place to get a burrito! The burrito is huuge so it's really worth the price you pay for it. Every bit of it is delicious. It's always hot and fresh! Plus you get some free chips to go along with it. This is my favorite place to get a burrito, but I don't know if it is good for anything else on the menu. I'm sure it is though if the burritos are so damn awesome.
author: Bets Y.

description: So I get on the bus from what seems like a long day at work. These dumb ass hoodlums also get on the bus. One of them sits next to me, and puts his arm around me. I ask him politely to move his arm, and he refuses and talks back. And then his other homeboy tells me not to worry about him and then attempts at getting my phone number. While he is doing that another one of them ashes his blunt on my foot. So I get up from my chair really irritated and then tell them to f*ck off. Then they start saying more sh*t to me. I start yelling right back, and I'm usually not like that, but I'm tired as hell. When I find another seat, I just blast my music on my Zune really loud. When I get off the bus, we're just cussing at each other, while they're still sitting on the bus. And then one of them throws a water bottle at me. Anyway I get home so irritated. But to my surprise, sitting on the kitchen table are Cinco De Mayo super burritoes and nachos. And with each bite, I forget how about angry I am, and remember that tomorrow is another day. I grew up loving this taqueria since my sister introduced it to me when I was in middle school. And me and a good friend of mine would come here sometimes every week in high school. It really got me through the hard times. Even though I've had other taquerias, and sometimes they may have tasted a lil better, I still love this place more. Thank you Cinco De Mayo for always being there and your life lessons.
author: April D.

description: DISCLAIMER: My review is based on the food itself, not on the restaurant. I have been coming here since my high school years, and all I can say is that the burritos here are the best in the Portola District. The burritos here are juicy and pack a lot of flavor. If you went to Thurgood and never went here, you definitely missed out.
author: Gerry L.

description: Cinco De Mayo is THE BEST taqueria in San Franciso.  Their burritos are amazing!  The meat is seasoned to perfection and the portions are huge.  Even though a little pricey, it is definitely worth it to try it out.  I highly recommend the steak burrito, nachos, and the super quesadilla.  TRY IT! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.
author: Edward C.

description: yum! I love their nachos. I never seen any other nachos like theirs before. its gi-normous! The first time they opened, I didn't like it. I had their normal burrito and wasn't that impressed. A few months later, my friend tells me I have to try it again. It's her favorite Mexican restaurant and she raves about it, religiously. So I decided to try their nachos and fell in love. They close at 8 everyday I think.
author: Abby A.

description:
i loves me some cinco de mayo

in high school, i used to go to this place around once a week.  now that i'm in college, i fall into SF taqueria burrito withdrawals :[ i'll either go to cinco de mayo or el farolitos (my faves) to fix my cravings

cinco de mayo burritos are sooooo juicy, there's no other way to describe them.  i love the super carne asada, chicken or carne asada&shrimp burritos.  SO GOOD.

their pico de gallo is awesome too- you always have to ask the woman at the cashier for some though, they don't automatically put it into your bag.

their super tacos are HUGE and really filling. i've tried their nachos as well. everything i get here is always spot on. i wish they had more hours though.
author: Cee L.

description: One of the best burritos i've head is here, they're big juicy and they give you a big bag of chips. I would recommend this place to anyone
author: Jack L.

description: A hidden gem is right.  If more foodies hung out on this side of San Bruno, I'm sure this place's reputation would be sky high, because the burritos are phe-freaking-nomenal.  The carne asada is seasoned beautifully and grilled right there, and all the grease and meat juice doesn't soak off while the meat's sitting in a tub, but ends up in your absolutely massive burrito...mixed with some hot sauce, the experience is just sublime.  Juicy, filling, flavor explosions, these burritos are.
author: Keane N.

description: A hidden gem. One of THE tastiest, most jaw-droppingly good burritos you can get in the city, period. It's very out of the way for most, but it's very much worth the trip for a completely unique burrito mastication ceremony that is completely unlike any other. Ignore any reviews with anything less than 5 stars, as these people, quite literally, are retarded and would not know a good burrito if they were hit in the eye with it. And these mothers are HUGE....they are more than a burrito...more like a 3-day internal pet. Incredible. This place will go down in my burrito scrapbook of wonderful life-affirming experiences. These burritos will make you happy to be alive.
author: Michael P.

description: Excellent burritos.  The seasoning of their meat beats many of the usual taquerias.  In fact I can think of anyone who does it better.  The carnitas are outstanding.  It would even be worth a trip to this edge of the city destination.
author: p w.

description: If you find yourself on San Bruno Ave and you have a taste for a taco or two this is a good place to eat.
author: ein bier bitte k.

description: I LOVE this place!  RIGHT by my house, the Super Nachos are amaaaaaaaaaaaazingly good, and the carne asada they use is pretty damn good.  It's one of the things that always brings a smile to my face to go up there on a lazy afternoon, get some nachos and a Corona, or mexican coke.  Atmosphere is pretty nice, and never had any problem with the cashiers.
author: Sean V.

description: burritology.  this place can school a lot of the taquerias i've been to in northern california.  they have excellent carne asada as iit pretty much tastes like the carne asada found at the 'berto's chains in southern california\nevada.  they have an excellent red salsa as well.  the place isn't quite perfect though.  the price of 5.60 for a regular burrito is on the higher end.  it's also out in the portola area, which isn't really near anything.  however, the price premuim is something i can afford, and i now live a couple blocks from this place so it gets the hi-five from me.  if more people ventured out to this place it really would be like the hi-v  because it would be a full blown pandemic.
author: Raleigh W.

description: I came here not expecting much because it was completely dead inside. Had I read the reviews before I went, I would have expected much more and lowered the rating. I ordered the carne asada which was good, but not THAT good. Also, the chips and red sauce they gave were much too salty for my liking.
author: edmond s.

description: I'm going to give this place a top notch grade. It's been in my lunch rotation for the past eight years and deservedly so.  This is far from the Chipotles and Rubios of the world.  I think the key phrase to describe this place is "hidden gem".  I rotate between ordering super burritos: carne asada - juicy and succulent with fewer gristle pieces and unchewable parts than most other places! Between that and the carnitas and al pastor, I've got enough variety to satisfy my appetites.  They have way more on the menu, it's just that I'm content with those.  I've had comparable burritos in the Mission, but I still like this one the best.  Unless I'm in LA and getting one of their best, this kicks the collective butts of all others.
author: Erick K.

description: I tried cinco de mayo last night for dinner. Aparently, by what everyone says, their burritos are great, but none of us had one. We usually get our burritos from la loma down the street. This is your usual walk in, order at the counter spot, with some chairs.  We got takeout. I wish there were a mexican place that delivers. S had tacos, which I never even got to see, much less try, because he inhaled them before I got into the room, but he liked them. J and I both had the same thing - the two enchiladas plate with one beef and one pork, and verde sauce. When we ordered them, the woman at the counter warned that verde sauce would be very hot, and we said that's fine. After I had finished eating, I remembered she said that... I don't know why, because it was not only not hot, it was so so mild. I couldn't taste any hot or spiciness to it at all. Besides that, they were tasty. Not gigantic, but normal sized. They came with lettuce, avocados (yay) and sour cream, as well as some runny, tasteless beans and tasteless rice, and chips. So, I think entrees are good (though lacking in spiciness) but they need to work on the sides. I would come here again, and just add some hot sauce to it for seasoning. Or maybe I should try the burrito.
author: Merredith L.

description: how does it feel to have THE BEST burrito ever made? bc that's how i feel about this place! the meat is thoroughly seasoned.. the flavors compliment one another... on top of another.. on top of another.. on top of another.. isnt that the "ideal" of food anyway? dont skimp out and get the basic burrito.. go for the one in the middle with the works... give your palate a sensual exploration and go for the FLAVOR
author: geoffrey l.

description: This is the BEST burrito place by far......The have the best vegetarian burritos ever. Nice people. Juicy burritos. Decent prices. I have been going here for more than 7 years and I recommend it to everyone I know. All my friends eat here and everyone I know loves this place.
author: SF N.

description: my favorite burrito joint. they're a bit cheap on the chips + salsa though. a super chicken burrito from cinco de mayo always knocks me out.
author: Andy H.
